00015 #ifndef GEVENT_H_
00016 #define GEVENT_H_
00017 
00018 #include "mos.h"
00019 
00020 /* The default address for the simulation server is localhost.
00021  * Use -vizaddress on the command line to change it.
00022  */
00023 #define GEVENT_ADDRESS          "127.0.0.1"
00024 /* The default port for the sending to the simulation server is 1521.
00025  * Use -vizsendport on the command line to change it.
00026  */
00027 #define GEVENT_SEND_PORT        1521
00028 /* The default port for receiving events from the simulation server is the 
00029  * value of the node's ID.  Use -vizrecvport on the command line to change it.
00030  */
00031 
00032 /* These event types should match those in src/tools/tenodera/modules/events.py
00033  * Some of these are not used in XMOS, but are included so you know they are
00034  * already reserved.
00035  */
00036 #define NEW_NODE_EVENT                  1
00037 #define REMOVE_NODE_EVENT               2
00038 #define RADIO_PACKET_EVENT              3
00039 #define NET_SUBSCRIBE_EVENT             4
00040 #define NET_UNSUBSCRIBE_EVENT   5
00041 #define LED_EVENT                               6
00042 #define EXIT_EVENT              7
00043 #define MOVE_NODE_EVENT         8
00044 #define RADIO_MODEL_LINK        9
00045 #define REMOVE_ALL_EVENT                10
00046 #define RADIO_MODEL_FORWARD             11
00047 #define LAUNCH_NODE_EVENT       12
00048 #define DISCONNECT_NODE_EVENT   13
00049 #define KILL_NODE_EVENT         14
00050 
00051 #define MAX_EVENT_TYPE                  14
00052 
00053 #define MAX_EVENT_SIZE                  256
00054 
00055 /* This stuff only works in XMOS. */
00056 #ifdef PLATFORM_LINUX
00057 
00058 #include <stdint.h>
00059 
00060 /* Set to non-zero if we have successfully connected to the simulation server.
00061  * Unset this if the connection has had an unrecoverable error.
00062  */
00063 extern int gevent_connected;
00064 
00065 /* Set up connection to the simulation server and start the receive thread.
00066  * You must start the node with the -viz argument if you want to connect
00067  * to the simulation server.
00068  * Returns 0 on success, -1 on error.
00069  */
00070 int gevent_init();
00071 
00072 /* Format the arguments into a packet.  Format string tells how to
00073  * pack the data:
00074  * 
00075  * Ni   - next N arguments are 32-bit ints
00076  * Ns   - next argument points to an array of char, copy N chars from it
00077  * x    - get N from next argument, then copy N chars from subsequent argument
00078  * 
00079  * If the server is not up, output the arguments with printf() using 'message' 
00080  * as the format string.
00081  * Returns 0 on success, -1 on error.
00082  */
00083 int gevent_send(uint32_t type, const char* format, const char* message, ...);
00084 
00085 /* Receive and parse an event from the simulation server.
00086  * This function blocks until an event is available.
00087  * Format string tells how to fill in arguments:
00088  * 
00089  * Ni   - next N arguments are pointers to 32-bit ints
00090  * Ns   - copy N chars to the next argument, which points to a char array
00091  * x    - copy the rest of the packet into a char array
00092  * 
00093  * Returns size of event on success, -1 on error.
00094  */
00095 int gevent_recv(uint32_t type, const char* format, ...);
00096 
00097 #else /* We are compiling for the sensor node; the gevent functions do nothing. */
00098 
00099 #define gevent_connected                                                                0
00100 #define gevent_init()                                                                   0
00101 #define gevent_send(type,format,msg,args...)                    0
00102 #define gevent_recv(type,format,args...)                                0
00103 
00104 #endif  /* PLATFORM_LINUX */
00105 
00106 #endif /* GEVENT_H_ */
